titleStmt.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; names of other characters like Ḥanna and ʾIyaqem (fol. 13vb), Yoḥannǝs ʾAfä Wärq (fol. 15vb), Gäbrǝʾel (fols. 20rb, 112vc, 120rc), Yoḥannǝs (fols. 11rc, 150rc-152vb), Ṗawlos (fol. 149vb), ʾabba Gäbrä Krǝstos (fols. 161rc-vb, 171ra-vc), Abrǝham (fols. 159vb, 160rb-vb), ʾabba Sinoda and ʾAbsadi (fol. 163rb-vc), ʾAnorewos (fol. 170rbc); names of the donor and his relatives; other words like sälam läki "salutation to you" (fols. 12ra, 15ra), ḥǝḍan (fols. 21rc, 49va, 50rab, 67vc, 68ra, 74rc, 84va. 89rbc), dǝngǝl (fol. 30vbc), wälätt (fols. 66rc, 74rc-vb), bǝʾǝsi (fol. 109ra-vc); elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; a few lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-4; the incipit of Text II and sections of Text I (sometimes alternating with black lines).

msItem.note: - Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq ... "Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…" (fol. 12ra-rb).
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus kähali ... "O my Lady Mary, Mother of our Lord Jesus the Almighty ..." (fol. 14vb) (cp. ChRep no. 373)
- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour, Mother of the Light ..." (fol. 15ra-va).

All miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered; the numbers are written in the margins. Some miracles conclude with an extended, rhymed supplication for the commissioner and scribe (fols. 27rc, 28rc-va, 29rc, 31rc-va, 38ra, 44rb-rc, 52va, 58rc-va, passim).
Text I concludes with a subscriptio (fol. 174rb).

msItem.colophon: Fol. 175va: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ተጽሕፈት፡ በ፫ዓመተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወመስፍነ፡ ሀገርነሂ፡ ራስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ መምህርነሂ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘጊዮርጊስ፡ ወአፈ፡ መምህር፡ አባ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ጽዮን፡ እሉ፡ ፪፡ ደቂቁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ ኢየሱስ። ወቄስ፡ ገበዝ፡ አባ፡ አንቀጸ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወአባ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ጽዮን። Fol. 175va: This book was written in the third year of the reign of our King Täklä Haymanot and (in the time of) the governor of our land ras Mikaʾel, our mämhǝr ʾabunä Zä-Giyorgis and ʾafä mämhǝr ʾabba Fǝśśǝḥa Ṣǝyon who are both children of ʾabunä Gäbrä ʾIyäsus, and qes gäbäz ʾAnqäṣä Haymanot and ʾabba Fǝśśǝḥa Ṣǝyon. The colophon is followed by a longer pen trial.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 175.0 folios, of which blank Fols. 1v-3r, 4v-6r, 6vb-7v, 8v, 12vb, 16v-17v, 175r, 175vb-176v., in 23.0 quires (A+22).
36.6 33.0 8.2

collation.signatures: Decorated - Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner: fols. 9r: ፩, 18r: ፪ (erased), 26r: ፫, 34r: ፬, 42r: ፭, 50r: ፮, 58: ፯, 67r: ፰, 75r: ፱, 83r: ፲, 91r: ፲፩, 98r: ፲፪, 106r: ፲፫, 114: ፲፬, 122: ፲፭, 130: ፲፮, 139: ፲፯, 147: ፲፰, 155: ፲፱, 163: ፳, 169: ፳፩.

list.item: 6 A(6; sl.: {3}, stub after 2; {5}, no stub/fols. 1r-6v)

8 ፳፩XXII(8/fols. 169r-176v)
Quire A includes leaves (fols. 2-5) which were added later; also quire II was added later.

supportDesc.condition: The spine cover has been damaged and repaired. Holes or tears are carefully amended on fols. 21, 24, 30, 59, 113, 115, 170, 173.

layout.note: Quire II: all data for fol. 10r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Quires III-XXII: all data for fol. 19r.
layout.ab: Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C; sometimes the horizontal lines are of Type B (e.g., fols. 12, 19, 24-25, 27-28, 43, 49, 60, 66, 68, 76, 80, 82).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some leaves have an additional crudely ruled line in the upper margin (fols. 50, 57) or at the bottom (fols. 92, 96; two lines on fols. 83r, 90).

handDesc.handNote: Mediocre Black, red Kǝnfä RufaʾelKǝnfä Rufaʾel is mentioned as the scribe in many supplication formulas (fols. 28va, 31va, 41rc, 44rc, 52va etc.).Second half of the 18th century

list.item: Fol. 6va: Record concerning the gathering of the monks to prohibit the selling of the monastery's books. Fol. 6va: ይቤሉ፡ መምህራን፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ ካህናት፡ ወሊቃውንት፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ ተጋቢኦሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። እስመ፡ ሰምዑ፡ ከመ፡ ሤጥዎን፡ ለብዙኃት፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ትካት፡ አብዳን፡ ሰብእ፡ አውሪዶሙ፡ እምደብር። ወበእንተዝ፡ ይቤሉ፡ አሠርነ፡ ወአውገዝነ፡ በቃልነ፡ ከመ፡ ኢትፃእ፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ እምአንቀጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ወካዕበ፡ ይቤሉ፡ ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘሠረቃ፡ ወፈሐቃ፡ ወአውረዳ፡ እምደብር፡ ወአውፅአ፡ እምአንቀጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ለርእይ፡ ወአንብቦ፡ በውስቴታ፡ ይኩን፡ ውጉዘ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ቃሎሙ፡ ለጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ አጋዕዝቲነ። ወበቃሉ፡ ለአረጋዊ፡ አቡነ፡ ወበቃለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ እሙ፡ ለመድኃኒነ። Fol. 6va: Gathered in the church, teachers and all priest and masters of Däbrä Dammo said (the following) because they heard that foolish men sold many old books having taken them down from the mountain. Because of this they said, "We condemn and excommunicate with our word that this book may not leave the gate of the church". And furthermore they said, "The one who stole this book or erased (its text) or took it down from the mountain or brought it out from the gate of the church except for looking or reading inside shall be excommunicated by the authority of the word of our lords Peter and Paul and by the word of our father ʾArägawi and by the word of our Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, mother of our Saviour". The note, written in the main hand, has been partly corrected by the same hand; six lines have been erased at the end.

Fol. 12rb-va: Excerpt from the Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah.Fol. 12rb: ወያንብቡ፡ ዘንተ፡ ትእዛዘ፡ እምቅድመ፡ አንብቦ፡ ተአምር፡ በኵሉ፡ እኁድ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ በዓላቲሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። ከመ፡ ኢይምሰሎሙ፡ ለክ[ር]ስቲያን፡ ቀሊለ፡ ሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እስመ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ወክቡር፡ ውእቱ። ...
The initial line and the name of Mary are rubricated.

Fol. 174rc: Donation note.Fol. 174rc: ለዛቲ: ተአምር፡ አጽሐፍክዋ፡ በንዋይየ። አነ፡ ወልደ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ረድኡ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ማትያስ። ወወሀብክዋ፡ ለመቅደሰ፡ አቡየ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ። ከመ፡ ትኩነኒ፡ ዓራቂተ፡ ምስለ፡ አምላኪየ፡ ኄር። እምጣነ፡ አልብየ፡ አሐቲ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ። ለክሙኒ፡ ኦአበውየ፡ ወአኃውየ፡ በእንተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እስእለክሙ፡ በፍቅር፡ መንፈሳዊ። ከመ፡ ኢትርስኡኒ፡ በሕይወትየ፡ ወበሞትየ። እስመ፡ አልብየ፡ ዘመድ፡ ዘእንበሌክሙ፡ ወተአምሩ፡ አንትሙ፡ ከመ፡ የዓቢ፡ እኅው፡ መንፈሳዊ። እምነ፡ እኅው፡ ሥጋዊ።
The note is written in the main hand, in red ink. It states that Wäldä ʾArägawi, disciple of ʾabunä Matǝyas, donated the Ms. to Däbrä Dammo. He pleads with the fathers and brothers not to forget him during his life and death because he does not have relatives to ask for.

- The title ተአምረ፡ ማርያም and the internal number of the monastic library (338) are written on fol. 1r together with two short notes: ዝተአምር፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ መካነ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ፡ "This is the (book of) miracles of Däbrä Dammo, the place of ʾabunä ʾArägawi" and ተአምር፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርየም "Miracles of Our Lady Mary". - Musical notation: fols. 11rb-12rb. - A secondary hand has added to some supplication: ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ አግብርቲሃ "and with all of us, her servants" (fols. 18ra, 19vb, 29rc, 58va) or ወምስሌነሂ "and also with us" (fols. 20vc, 23va).
- Erasures are marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 9vb, 25rb, 49ra, 51vb, 57rc, 67ra, 76ra, 90vc, 93rc, 110vb, 112vc, 113rab, 117rc, 120rb, 124vab, 149rb, 154rb, 161va, 162rb, 170vb, 173vc. - Thin lines are used to fill the line: fols. 65rb, 68vb, 69rc, 92ra-vc, 158ra (at the end of several lines). - Omissions are inserted interlineally: fols. 9ra, 10va, 43ra, 53vc, 55vb, 57rc, 57vb, 70ra, 71rc, 72rc, 92rc, 93rc, 114va, 120rb, 120va, 126vc, 129va, 132rb, 142vb, 143vb, 148rb (in red), 152va, 159rb (in red), 160ra, 163vc. - Omitted incipit of one miracle is written in the upper margin on fol. 90r. - Corrections are written over erasures: fols. 112vb, 170rc. - Pen trial, mentioning Tuesday: fol. 177v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches (and their traces) at the spine cover, close to the head of the codex.

Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 8 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, small x, corni form, criss cross, double crescent, double sine wave with dots, cross hatching).

origin.origDate:
According to the colophon, the Ms. was written in the third year of the reign of King Täklä Haymanot who is King Täklä Haymanot II (r. 1769-77), put on the throne by ras Mikaʾel Sǝhul on 17 October 1769. Ras Mikaʾel is also mentioned in the colophon.
Fols. 2-5 (quire A), dating possibly to the 17th cent., and quire I, dating probably to the 16th century, were added later.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 3, the Ms. was donated by Wäldä ʾArägawi, disciple of ʾabunä Matǝyas. Both names are mentioned in supplication formulas, sometimes written interlineally in the main hand. In addition, further names were added to supplication formulas by the main hand: his father Zä-Wäldä Maryam (fols. 19vc, 25ra, 32rc etc.) and his mother ʾAmätä Krǝstos (fols. 22vc, 25rc etc.).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
